questions.question: Even though my sister is a graduate, she cannot put her ideas …………………….. in English.
questions.description: To put your ideas across is to express them.

questions.question: As he is very prudent, he cannot be ………………………… easily.
questions.description: To take somebody in is to deceive them.

questions.question: Nobody can ………………………… with him because he has such a bad temper.
questions.description: To get along with somebody is to have a nice relationship with them.

questions.question: She ………………………….. to her frustrations by yelling at the kids.
questions.description: To give vent to your frustrations is to express them freely.

questions.question: The boy ……………………………… his father.
questions.description: To take after somebody is to resemble them.

questions.question: The meeting has been …………………………..
questions.description: To put something off is to postpone it.

questions.question: I can never ………………………….. injustice.
questions.description: To put up with something is to tolerate it.

questions.question: I can get a job in your office if you ………………………… a word for me.
questions.description: To put in a word for somebody is to recommend them.

questions.question: It is easy to ……………………………… the government but it is difficult to find solutions to our problems.
questions.description: To run down somebody is to criticize them.

questions.question: The fire brigade struggled to ……………………………… the fire.
He faced his enemy bravely but in the end he was compelled to …………………………..
questions.description: To give in is to surrender.

questions.question: The woman …………………………… as she narrated her painful experience.
questions.description: Break down can mean ‘be overwhelmed with emotion’.
